page.title: 01TYPICAL BROCKENHURST BLOCK
page.content: The{Sway Road}Brockenhurst with its grassed verges comprises substantial twentieth century houses; the{five {culs-de-sac}on its eastern side have houses of similar age but varied type and size.{South Weirs}has nineteenth century cottages facing the open forest and an unmade road.{Sandy Down is an area of expensive twentieth century property in large secluded gardens. Enclosed grazing land and a{Golf {Course}flank Brockenhurst village but the rest of the area is open heathland covering a dissected plateau at heights of 40 metres, apart from the NE where the private estates of {Brockenhurst Park}and{Roydon Manor}are flanked by woodland. The block is traversed from North to South by the {London to Bournemouth railway.
